Desc.entry: The forum works in the Yorkshire and Humberside region and beyond to advance the social, economic and cultural contributions of faith communities. Recognising the rich ethnic, cultural and faith diversity in the region, it seeks to encourage and educate faith communities to work together in matters of policy, strategy and action. The forum seeks to challenge all forms of discrimination and injustice against persons or groups of people, particularly relating to religious beliefs. The faith forum is open to all people, organisations, groups and faith communities; bringing people together through events, newsletters and email and is overseen by a council whos members are drawn from the 9 faiths recognised by the Interfaith Network UK, namely Baha'I, Buddhists, Christian, Hindu, Jain, Jewish, Muslim, Sikh and Zoroastrian.
